item.title: Rural Villa in Chedworth
item.description: Province Britannia Province Description Location Chedworth Chedworth (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Chedworth Keywords archaeological garden animal bone bathhouses (water recreation structures) drains mosaics (visual works) rural villas sherds villae rusticae Garden Description This Roman villa in Gloucestershire was partially excavated in the late 19th century, but only the built features and their mosaic floors appear to have been of interest to the Victorian diggers. Excavations in the courtyard conducted between 2000 and 2002 revealed that earlier excavators had not disturbed the courtyard. Parts of the villa may date to the early 3rd century A.D. at the latest, but extensions to existing buildings and the arrangement of the residential wings around an open courtyard can be ascribed to the early 4th century (Fig. 1). The slightly trapezoidal courtyard had a maximum width of 25 meters and a maximum length of 40 meters.
